entry.title: What's New in 2511 - Release Navigator for Spend Management
entry.content:
We're thrilled to announce the upcoming innovations for our 2511 Release! Our dedicated team has been working tirelessly to ensure you stay ahead with the latest enhancements. Below you can access the Release Navigator for Spend Management and easily locate all essential resources for a successful release, feature highlights for the upcoming release, and ways to connect to stay up to date!

Over the coming months, we'll be revamping and enriching our related content to mirror the newest advancements. Currently users can still access Business Network via the Release Navigator for Spend Management, you will be redirected to the Release Navigator for Supply Chain Management. As this journey continues, SAP Business Network content will begin to migrate from Spend Management communications to Supply Chain Management communications and portals! Dive into the 2511 release details below. 

Here are feature Highlights for the 2511 release for SAP Ariba and SAP Business Network. Make sure to read through the blogs to learn more about these features and ensure you are properly prepared for these updates.

  • Accelerated Release Cycle for SAP Integration Suite, managed gateway for spend management and SAP Business Network Add-On 1.0 for SAP S/4HANA and SAP ECC (BPI-596)
  • AI Copilot Joule in SAP Ariba Supplier Risk (SRISK-1848)
  • AI Copilot Joule in SAP Ariba Contracts (SCONTR-1279)
  • Use of Spend Data for AI Recommendations in Category Segmentation (ARBCATA-504)
  • New Transactional Use Cases for Approvals and Navigational Use Cases for AI Copilot Joule in SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance (SLP-2288)
  • Spend Analysis Benchmarks — Company vs Industry Performance (ANALYSIS-1324)

Follow the Spend Management and Business Network and ReadinessS@Scale community tags, and Ryan Russman to stay up to date with the latest blog posts.

The 2511 release will incorporate release content updates only. With the migration of SAP Business Network to Supply Chain Management, the Release Navigator for Spend Management will continue to publish content updates but may delay UX updates to help minimize disruption to customers and partners.

Support.SAP.com – Release Ready page 

SAP Activate – Roadmap Viewer  

SAP Enterprise Support Value Map - SAP Enterprise Support Value Map for Spend Management and Business Network

Making Your Impact

At SAP, we greatly appreciate your input and suggestions. You are invited to submit feedback and suggest topics to be covered through our Topic Request & Feedback Survey. This survey provides you with an opportunity to provide insights on your experience with the release navigator for Spend Management and Business Network, as well as suggestions on how we can further enhance your release experience. Additionally, we encourage you to share your feedback, thoughts, or questions in the comment section below.

entry.title: SAP Build Work Zone in Integrated Product Development: A Step-by-Step Setup Guide
entry.content:
Why SAP Build Work Zone for IPD?

In complex IPD environments, teams work with various applications, from CAD systems to PLM tools and collaboration platforms. SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition provides a central access point for all enterprise applications and reduces complexity for end users. The platform enables the creation of role-based, personalized business sites with flexible content structures.

Prerequisites

Before starting the setup, ensure the following prerequisites are met:

  • SAP BTP Subaccount: An active SAP Business Technology Platform subaccount with appropriate permissions
  • Administrator Rights: Subaccount administrator or corresponding roles for configuration
  • SAP Cloud Identity Services: Access to Identity Authentication Services (IAS) for user management

Step-by-Step Setup Guide

1. Start Booster for SAP Build Work Zone

Navigate to the "Boosters" section in your SAP BTP Cockpit and search for "SAP Build Work Zone". The booster automates the basic configuration steps for your subaccount.

2. Select Subaccount

Choose the appropriate subaccount where SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition should be set up.

3. Start your application "SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition"

4. Create and Name Website

5. Link Launchpad_Admin Role with Identity Services

For role management, navigate in the cockpit side panel to:

  • Security → Trust Configuration
  • Click on the tenant you created in SAP Cloud Identity Services

  • A screen opens on the right side - click on the "Attribute Mappings" tab and then "Edit"

  • Under the "Role Collection" column, select the Launchpad_Admin role from the dropdown list

  • Enter "Groups" as attribute and "Admin" as value. Click "+" to add the attributes and save

The mapping is complete. You can now access SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition.

Create a Site

When you create a site, you'll be redirected to the Site Studio Site Settings screen. By enabling "Spaces and Pages – New Experience" view mode, you can create spaces and pages locally in dedicated editors.

  • Click "Edit" in the upper right corner of the Site Settings screen
  • Under "Display" select "Spaces and Pages - New Experience"

  • Go to Site Directory to view the site tile

Your site is empty.

General Process

The general process is structured in the following steps: Apps → Pages → Spaces → Roles → Users

Configure Apps

Click the Content Manager icon in the side panel to open the Content Manager. You'll see a list of content elements added to your subaccount.

  • Go to Content Explorer and select your content
  • Choose the channel for your content

  • Select the channel functionalities and add them to your content

  • After adding functionalities from various applications, add them to your own content

Create Pages

  • Create a page

  • Add a name for the page, description, header, and select relevant widgets

  • Create this for all other necessary applications for IPD

Create Spaces

1. First decide whether one or multiple spaces are necessary

Check your requirements:

  • Do all users have the same access rights?
  • Do you need different security levels?

→ One space with multiple pages is optimal in most cases. Multiple spaces mean exponentially higher administrative complexity.

a) Create one space
Content Manager → Create → Space

  • Add title: e.g., "IPD Workspace", add description
  • Assign pages to space: activate assignment status for all pages
  • Order by priority
  • Save

b) Create multiple spaces
Content Manager → Create → Space:

  • "Collaboration Space"
  • "Specification Management Space"

2. Assign space to Everyone role
Content Manager → Everyone → Edit → Spaces Tab:

  • Activate assignment status for space and save

3. Complete site configuration
Site Directory → Site Settings → Edit:

  • View Mode: "Spaces and Pages - New Experience"
  • Confirm Everyone role

Role Assignments

1. Perform role assignments

a) Use Everyone role when:

  • All users should have access to IPD apps
  • You need a simple, quick solution
  • No differentiated permissions are required

Procedure:

  • Assign apps to Everyone role (activate Assignment Status)
  • Done - no further BTP role assignments needed

b) Create custom IPD role

  • Click Edit in Site Settings

  • In the Assignments area, add your created role ("+" symbol)

Additional Role Information

In addition to the setup steps described above, you can assign predefined roles to users for accessing specific applications within SAP Integrated Product Development. These role templates simplify permission management and ensure that users have access to the right tools and functionalities based on their responsibilities.

For more information, see the official SAP Help documentation: Role Templates for SAP Integrated Product Development .

  • Switch to BTP Cockpit
  • Navigate to Security → Users
  • Select your user
  • Click "Assign Role Collection"
  • Search for your created role and assign it

Conclusion

SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition proves to be a central solution for IPD challenges. The systematic implementation - from booster configuration through structured apps, pages, and spaces to thoughtful role management - creates an efficient work environment.

In the next blog, I will detail the integration of SAP Joule into the Work Zone and show how AI-powered functions can further increase productivity in IPD processes.

entry.title: SAP Cloud ALM中国区正式落地：以云端应用生命周期管理加速价值实现，助力云与混合场景的高效运维
entry.content:
我们非常高兴地向您宣布，SAP Cloud ALM目前已在中国区正式上线！

SAP Cloud ALM是一站式云原生ALM平台，覆盖从实施到运维的全生命周期。通过简化流程、提升透明度与协作、统一监控与可观测性及端到端追溯，它帮助您加速项目与升级交付，确保上线后稳定运行与持续优化，并满足治理与合规要求。本地部署/混合场景可与现有工具并行启用，无需“切换日”，在中国区获得更佳的网络与合规体验。

为什么选择SAP Cloud ALM

  • 立刻可用，提升运维效能：统一监控本地与云端关键业务流程、接口与作业，集中告警与仪表盘管理，显著降低系统停机与业务中断风险。支持与现有工具（如SAP Solution Manager）并行使用，无需“切换日”，平滑过渡零风险。
  • 项目升级即刻增效，敏捷交付：内置SAP最佳实践与加速器，覆盖需求管理、用户故事、测试缺陷、变更发布、切换计划及里程碑追踪。直接支撑EHP升级、S/4HANA转换及集成项目，显著缩短交付周期，提升项目透明度与质量。
  • 转型预演，资产高效复用：在本地部署/混合环境先行开展Fit-to-Standard与流程监控，沉淀规范化的需求、测试与监控资产；未来推进业务转型时，可复用项目结构、测试集与监控规则，显著降低转型成本与中断风险。
  • 统一治理，协同合规：构建从需求到生产的端到端追溯与KPI，集中化风险/问题管理与变更审批，支撑各个团队在同一平台协作并满足审计合规，提升项目透明度与可控性。
  • 渐进启用、成本友好：无需额外采购，随订阅/维护权益启用(详见使用权限）；与现有工具并行、按场景逐步采用，避免一次性替换带来的成本与风险。

客户可获益

  • 实施更高效：利用预配置内容、需求与故事管理、项目与任务编排、测试管理与缺陷跟踪，变更与发布管理，显著缩短项目交付时间。
  • 运维更稳定：实时监控关键业务流程与接口链路，自动告警与修复建议，减少停机与业务中断风险。
  • 决策更明智：内置仪表盘与分析报表，提供项目进度、质量指标与运行健康度的可视化洞察。
  • 团队更协同：统一平台链接业务、IT与合作伙伴，实现跨团队协作与知识沉淀。
  • 成本更可控：基于云交付、无需部署复杂工具，降低维护成本与初始投入，已涵盖在您的云订阅或维护合同中。

主要功能概览

  • 实施阶段
    • 项目与任务管理、最佳实践与加速器、Fit-to-Standard流程导航
    • 需求与用户故事管理、测试计划与执行、缺陷管理
    • 变更管理与发布管理
    • 基于流程的端到端追溯，可配置报表与里程碑跟踪
  • 运维阶段
    • 业务流程监控：端到端流程可视化与异常告警
    • 接口与集成监控：包括API、消息与中间件链路的健康与性能
    • 健康与作业监控：系统与应用关键指标、后台作业状态
    • 用户与性能监控：端到端真实用户体验，快速定位影响关键流程的性能与可用性问题
    • 告警与事件管理：规则、阈值、路由与通知
    • 分析与仪表盘：运行趋势、容量与稳定性分析
  • 混合场景支持
    • 统一监控云与本地部署系统，覆盖跨系统集成与数据流
    • 与SAP BTP及常用集成服务的联动，提升跨域可观测性
  • 扩展与集成
    • 开放API与内容扩展，适配企业特定流程与治理模型
    • 与SAP支持渠道和最佳实践知识库联动

使用权益与启用说明

  • 对于RISE with SAP与GROW with SAP客户：SAP Cloud ALM作为标准能力随套餐提供，无需额外采购。
  • 对于采用SAP云产品的客户：大多数SAP云订阅均包含Cloud ALM使用权益，可直接申请启用。
  • 对于混合与本地部署场景：可在现有支持合同范围内启用相应的监控与运维功能，具体覆盖与可用性以您的合同与系统版本为准。
  • 启用步骤建议
    • 单击此处快速申请您的SAP Cloud ALM租户
    • 只需几个基本设置步骤完成初始化配置

重要说明: 功能覆盖、数据托管位置与启用路径可能因您的合同类型、系统版本与地区合规要求而有所差异。具体请以SAP官方条款与实施顾问建议为准。

我们也将通过中文线上研讨会与您分享更多最新的SAP Cloud ALM内容，敬请期待。如需进一步了解SAP Cloud ALM相关信息，或有任何问题和反馈，请随时与我们联系。

SAP Cloud ALM 中国团队

entry.title: Re: Multistage intercompany sales is not available in SAP...
entry.content:
Good day @andrj111 

Thank you for your question.

The following references will provide you with more details.

Support for New Process: Multistage Intercompany Stock Transfer and Sales

Blog: Advanced Intercompany Sales & Stock Transfer in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

To summarise, in public cloud, the multistage advanced intercompany process where goods or sales pass-through multiple company codes/multiple legal entities in a single process is not supported. That is a private cloud or On-Premise functionality. There is no official roadmap announcement for its delivery in public cloud.

However, you can:

  • Use the standard single-level advanced intercompany sales/stock transfer process that are supported in public cloud.
  • You may also consider raising a request through Customer Influence Portal referencing your business case to help drive prioritisation of the functionality.

Alternatively, you may consider workarounds such as:

  1. Splitting the process into multiple single-level intercompany transfers across your entities.
  2. Use selective extensions or side-by-side intergration to bride the gap. 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Add Custom Field in Material Document Header Level
entry.content:
Hi vijaysharma3

Could you provide some more details about your use case? For example, where to do want to view the custom field and how do you want to use it?

I guess you are asking why is there only material document Item and not header? Could you use Journal Entry?

It does seem odd - perhaps no one has asked for it until now. I would recommend you submit an Influence Request also.

Are you a 3SL customer? If so, please consider Developer Extensibility:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/32da8359c8ee4e8b8e8c5e15cacba5aa/c9cf3615cc5f4f71ae29c39d08848a96.html?version=LATEST&locale=en-US

Another option to consider might be a Custom Business Object and link the Material Document Header as a key field. You could perhaps then create a custom CDS View. With that approach, you could reference it in BADIs for example.

Just a note about custom field capacity, it is unfortunately fixed: Please see this help article: Before Getting Started with Custom Fields 

"On average, you can create 100 fields per business context and you have 1000 characters available for all business contexts, except Coding Block. You can see the currently available space when adding a new custom field in the Business Context Capacity indicator. The amount of capacity that a field requires depends on its type and the defined length."

Thank you
Jerry

entry.title: Re: SAP Crystal Reports for Visual Studio SP37 print some...
entry.content:
Only suggestion is as you suggested is to get a newer Printer. HP Print drivers had always been an issue with CR.

For example when we used to support access using crpe32.dll and using DEVMode structure and the DMExtra values when getting the StructSize HP drivers always returned a zero value, so app had to specify that value, otherwise the app would crash.

So it's not surprising those legacy printer drivers have issues...

Maybe try an updated HP Printer driver to see if it recognizes those old printers...

Only other option is to export the report to PDF and then print...

SAP offers XSL (Extensible Stylesheet Language) files for the contents of the ZIP file that is generated from the RC_COLLECT_ANALYSIS_DATA report. entry.title: Re: In EPPM, what's the accrual revenue calculation metho...
entry.content: Event based Rev Rec still uses the Results Analysis configuration.  Look at the RA configuration where G/L accounts are assigned to a Line ID (LID), this is where the values are aggregated and used for postings.  So it's not calculated on a G/L line item level, it's calculated on the LID level.

entry.title: Re: Automated mass updates for Asset
entry.content:
HI @aalmayyahi ,

Here is proposed solution.

 

AspectDetails
ObjectiveMass update of ~500 existing asset master records to modify fields under the Time-Dependent tab — Personal Number, Department, Division.
Current LimitationAS02 allows edits but only one asset at a time.
Recommended SolutionUse BAPI BAPI_FIXEDASSET_CHANGE with structure BAPIFIXASSET_TIMEDATA for automated upload.
Alternative Methods1️⃣ LSMW (Object 0105 – Asset Master: Change)2️⃣ MASS transaction (limited field access)3️⃣ Custom ABAP BDC for AS02 (legacy option).
Key Fields to UpdatePERSON_NO (Personal Number), DEPARTMENT (Department), DIVISION (Division).
BAPI ParametersStructure: BAPIFIXASSET_TIMEDATAFields: VALID_FROM, PERSON_NO, DEPARTMENT, DIVISION.
Input File (Excel/CSV)Columns: CompanyCode, AssetNumber, SubNumber, ValidFromDate, PersonalNumber, Department, Division.
Execution Flow1. Extract asset list (ANLA/ANLZ).2. Prepare Excel with new values.3. Run ABAP/LSMW calling BAPI.4. Commit in batches of 50–100.5. Validate via AS03/AW01N.6. Capture BAPIRET2 messages.
Sample Function CallsBAPI_FIXEDASSET_CHANGE → Update data.BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT → Save permanently.
Main Tables AffectedANLZ – Asset Time-Dependent Data.
Validation / ReportsAS03, AW01N, SE16N (ANLZ) for confirmation.
Error LoggingCapture messages from BAPIRET2 table for each asset.
Authorization CheckRequires change access (AIST, AICH, AS02).
Performance TipUse commit after 50–100 assets; avoid single commit per record.
Best PracticeTest in QA with 2–3 sample assets → Validate results → Transport to production.
Expected OutcomeAll 500 assets updated with new values in the same “Valid From” period; full change logs maintained automatically.
Feasibility✅ Fully supported by SAP; safe for productive use.
Effort Level🔹 Medium – requires ABAP or LSMW setup.
Recommended ApproachBAPI_FIXEDASSET_CHANGE – Reliable, auditable, efficient method for mass updates.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Empowering Business Users with Personalized News in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 Releas
entry.content: Hi Joceyln ,  The minimum SAPUI5 version for the Manage News app is not a single fixed number, as it depends on the specific release and feature packages. The Manage News app will be delivered to private cloud customers in the SAP S/4HANA 2025 release. The current release for SAP S/4HANA 2025 is based on the latest UI5 versions available for that release, and it's recommended to use the most current stable version for optimal performance.  Thanks, Caroline.

entry.title: Inquiries about OData V4- API_SALESORDERWITHOUTCHARGE and API_SALESORDER
entry.content:
Hi Expert,
 
I would like to inquire about the OData version 4 (API_SALESORDERWITHOUTCHARGE). Specifically, I need to know which on-premises SAP S/4HANA version will include this API.
 
I was able to find information about this OData V4 in the cloud edition at (https://api.sap.com/api/sap-s4-CE_SALESORDERWITHOUTCHARGE_0001-v1/overview), but I have not been able to find any relevant information for on-premises versions.
 
2. I am also confused about the API_SALESORDER. We are currently using on-premises Version 2023 FPS03, and I can find this API_SALESORDER in our system. However, the documentation at (https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/19d48293097f4a2589433856b034dfa5/3bac8c01d7024ae1b15cf848ce12544e.html), states that this OData V4 information is only available in the 2025 version.
 
Could anyone help to clear this confusion?
 
Thanks and Regards
Tan

entry.title: Re: Why SAP Crystal Reports Viewer doesn't support Window...
entry.content:
First thing I suggest is to upgrade to SP 38, the Viewer in SP 37 has a lot of issues.

You didn't answer directly so asking again, is this a WEB app?

If it is then possibly you need to use Sessions and PostBack functions, see this KBA:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/1985571

This keeps IIS using the same Report in session and any communications within the PostBack method.

The issue is CR can't directly communicate with IIS to pass the Preview back to the client. CR can't generate the page until the report is processed.

If it's a desktop app then I tested it using the latest Snagit and all I see is the Snagit's print preview.

And yes, using P2P is CR Basic Printer function, to have more control you should use POC API.

See my sample printer app on this page:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SUPPORT_CONTENT/crystalreports/3354091173.html?locale=en-US

Printing Crystal Reports in .NET

Select the printer, Set  Printerand then using POC button to print, see if that works for you.
